src:
Gabrijel Dek je hladan kao špricer, Real dobio Baskoniju u poslednjoj sekundi (VIDEO)
Neverovatna završnica u Španiji

03 Nov 2019

Vodio je Real dvocifrenom razlikom, potom je sebi zagorčao život i jurio prednost tokom većeg dela drugog poluvremena, ali je imao sreću da u svojim redovima ima Gabrijela Deka. Fantastični Argentinac rešio je da sam završi poslednju akciju na utakmici kada je rezultat na semaforu bio nerešen i pogodio je za nevericu na tribinama - 89:91.
Bio je to pravi revolveraški okršaj na obe strane terena. Real je čak 35 puta šutao sa distance na ovoj utakmici, ali je imao sreću da je pogodio 14 puta. Sa druge strane, Baskonija je šutirala utoliko manje, ali je bila daleko preciznija, pošto je imala 11/21. No, to nije bilo dovoljno...
Gotovo svi procenti su bili na strani Baskonije, čak su njeni košarkaši imali i bolji zbirni indeks, ali ni to nije bilo dovoljno da se na leđa baci moćni Real Madrid. Ekipa Pabla Lasa jednostavno obožava neizvesne završnice, mislili su svi da i večeras na crtu stati Serhio Ljulj, ali Mardiđani su iznedrili novog junaka.
Na semaforu je na oko 20 sekundi pred kraj stajao nerešen rezultat. Loptu je u svoje ruke preuzeo Gabrijel Dek. Trenutak po trenutak bližio se kraj meča, a onda... Argentinac je stao na poludistancu, uspeo je sebi da izgradi čistu poziciju, a lopta je prošla kroz mrežicu kao kap.



To kao da je poništilo sve uspone i padove koje su Kraljevići imali tokom čitavog dela utakmice. Jer kako objasniti da su sa čak 13 poena koliko su imali na poluvremenu, već na polovini treće četvrtine imali zaostatak od šest poena.
Doduše, uspravili su se nakon toga, uveli meč u neizvesnu završnicu i to im se na kraju isplatilo. Baskonija je konstantno jurila zaostatak u tim završnim minutima, ali poslednji koš nije mogla da nadoknadi, jer je došao uz zvuk sirene.
Da Dek nije postigao već pomenuti koš, Entoni Rendolf bi verovatno poneo epitet heroja, jer je meč završio sa čak 22 poena i indeksom 26. Pokušao je domaće da povuče napred Šengelija sa 20 poena, kao i Džening koji je imao 18 poena, ali to nije bilo dovoljno.
Baskijci su tako upisali već četvrti poraz u ACB ligi, tako da se sada nalaze čak van plej-of zone, dok je Real i dalje perfektan na prvom mestu sa skorom 7-0.

ACB LIGA - 7. KOLO

SubotaRiver Andora - Mursija 86:89Manresa - Bilbao 101:97 /nakon dva produžetka/San Pablo Burgos - Saragosa 69:78
NedeljaHuventud - Obradoiro 101:77Unikaha - Betis 79:71Estudijantes - Tenerife 72:74Baskonija - Real Madrid 89:91Barselona - Fuenlabrada 87:74Valensija - Gran Kanarija 86:88 /nakon produžetka/



Piše: Srđan TODOROVIĆFoto: Shutterstock
text:
Gabriel Dek is cold as a sprinter, Real got Basque last minute (VIDEO)
An amazing finish in Spain

03 Nov 2019

He led Real by a double-digit difference, then made a mess of himself and chased the lead for much of the second half, but was fortunate to have Gabriel Dek in his ranks. The fantastic Argentinean decided to finish the last action of the match by himself when the scoreboard was drawn and he scored for the disbelief in the stands - 89:91.
It was a real revolver on both sides of the field. Real have been kicked 35 times from distance in this game, but have been lucky to hit 14 times. Basque, on the other hand, shot even less, but it was far more accurate as it was 11/21. But that was not enough ...
Almost all percentages were on the Basque side, even its basketball players had a better aggregate index, but even that was not enough to throw the mighty Real Madrid back. The Pablo Las team simply adores the uncertain finishes, everyone thought that Serhio Ljulj would be on the line tonight, but the Mardians had introduced a new hero.
At the scoreboard, about 20 seconds before the end, there was a draw. The ball was taken by Gabriel Dek. Moment by moment the end of the match was approaching, and then ... The Argentine stepped on the half-volley, managed to build himself a clean position, and the ball went through the net like a drop.



It seemed to undo all the ups and downs that the Kings had throughout the entire game. Because how to explain that with as many as 13 points they had at halftime, they were already six points behind halfway through the third quarter.
Admittedly, they straightened up afterwards, brought the match into a precarious finish, and it eventually paid off. Basque Country was constantly chasing the backlog in those final minutes, but the last basket could not make up as it came with the sound of a siren.
If Dek had not scored, Anthony Randolph would probably have borne the epithet for the hero, as the match ended with as many as 22 points and an index of 26. He tried to pull the home team ahead of Schengeli by 20 points, as well as Jenning who had 18 points, but that it was not enough.
The Basque have already registered their fourth ACB league defeat, so they are now even out of the playoff zone, while Real is still perfect in first place with a 7-0 score.

ACB LEAGUE - ROUND 7

SaturdayRiver Andorra - Murcia 86: 89Manresa - Bilbao 101: 97 / after two extra time / San Pablo Burgos - Zaragoza 69:78
SundayHuventud - Obradoiro 101: 77Uniquha - Betis 79: 71Estudiantes - Tenerife 72: 74Bascia - Real Madrid 89: 91Barcelona - Fuenlabrada 87: 74Valencia - Gran Canaria 86:88 / after extra time /



By: Srdjan TODOROVICPhoto: Shutterstock
